desc: The HIST1H2BD gene encodes histone H2B type 1D. Histone proteins are an essential component of the nucleosome which consists of DNA wrapped around eight histone protein cores (two sets of each H2A, H2B, H3 and H4 histones), and therefore allow for the effective packaging of DNA in the nucleus (PMID:11498575). Ubiquitination of histone H2B at specific lysine residues leads to transcriptional activation and is a prerequisite for the placement of the activating mark H3K4me3 (PMID: 14563679, 12077605).
articles/1/title: Transcriptional activation via sequential histone H2B ubiquitylation and deubiquitylation, mediated by SAGA-associated Ubp8.
articles/2/title: Ubiquitination of histone H2B regulates H3 methylation and gene silencing in yeast.

desc: The HIST1H2BD gene encodes a histone H2B variant.
